metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38497 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Through use of reportValidity() and window.open(), a plain-text validation message could have been overlaid on another origin, leading to possible user confusion and spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 93, Thunderbird < 91.2, and Firefox ESR < 91.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38497` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '93.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
